intro: Arenaria jahnii, commonly known as the Jahn's sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to arid and rocky habitats in southern Africa, particularly in regions with well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its harsh environment. Its small, white or pink flowers bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. This species is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low precipitation, making it a resilient component of its ecosystem.
